bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to George Washington and Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 23 October [1872]
bibl.orgName: Walt Whitman House, Camden, New Jersey

revisionDesc.change: extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: Dont Don't be alarmed—& don't laugh either—at seeing the enclosed "will." I wish you to put it away with your papers, where it will be kept safe—I just took a notion to-day that I would like to fix it so—
I shan't come on till Monday next, 28th—but shall be with [you] then—think of coming in the 1 o'clock train from here—shall get to Camden by or before 8—I am well as usual—nothing new—
I have sent George my will to take charge of—I am writing this in the office, afternoon—we are having a dark rainy day here.

closer.salute: Love to you, dearest mother, & to Lou & all—
